DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of CP-195543 and celecoxib dual therapy in subjects with rheumatoid arthritis
DOC.brief_title: A Study Of CP-195543 And Celecoxib Dual Therapy In Subjects With Rheumatoid Arthritis
DOC.detailed_description: Trial enrollment was prematurely discontinued on December 3, 2007. The results of an interim efficacy and safety analysis demonstrated an overall poor tolerability profile and high discontinuation rate when dual therapy with CP-195543 and Celecoxib was administered. The decision to discontinue further enrollment in the trial was not based on any efficacy or serious safety concerns. Previously enrolled study participants continued in the study and the trial completed on February 27, 2008.
DOC.criteria: A diagnosis of RA based upon the American college of Rheumatology 1987 revised criteria Active disease at Screening Stable dose of methotrexate between 1025 mg/week oral or parenteral A diagnosis of any other inflammatory or secondary, noninflammatory arthritis that, in the opinion of the Investigator, would interfere with disease activity assessments A history of hypersensitivity or allergic type reactions to cyclooxygenase inhibitors, opiates, aspirin or sulfonamides
